item.description:
Boston's Chinatown always holds the Chinese New Year festival a week after the actual Lunar New Year, so let's take a walk and check it out. We'll start at Coolidge Corner, walk down Beacon St to Comm Ave, through the Public Gardens and the Commons, then into Chinatown.

I'm estimating the walk at about 90 minutes, which gets us to Chinatown at about 1pm. It gets really crowded, so we'll stop before heading in to Chinatown to see who's up for lunch and where to go.

Here's a flyer about the festival on the official website.

Here's the proposed map, 3.49 miles.

I am cross-posting this with the Ethnic Dining Out Meetup group in case the diners want some exercise.

We'll meet at Bruegger's in Coolidge Corner, it's down Harvard St a bit behind Trader Joe's. Please be there at 11:30 sharp, so we can get going and get into Chinatown. If you'll be late please call or text me. My cell # is 617-968-8113.

Since this is the first dual-group Meetup I'm organizing, I'm putting a limit of 15 people from each group, but I'm flexible with the #s. I'll keep an eye on it until the Meetup starts.
item.how_to_find_us: Green jacket, blue jeans, constantly looking around at people entering the store.
item.name: Chinese New Year festival - walk & eat
